providers.description: Official employment portal for jobs with the Commonwealth of Virginia, including state agencies and executive branch positions.
providers.eligibility: Open to qualified applicants; requirements vary by position
providers.name: Virginia State Jobs

providers.description: State agency administering unemployment insurance, employment services, and workforce development programs for Virginia residents.
providers.eligibility: Virginia residents seeking employment services or unemployment benefits
providers.name: Virginia Employment Commission

providers.description: Statewide workforce credential program offering short-term training aligned to high-demand jobs, with financial assistance for eligible Virginians.
providers.eligibility: Virginia residents; eligibility and funding vary by program and income
providers.name: FastForward Virginia

providers.description: Statewide preschool initiative providing free, high-quality early childhood education for eligible 3- and 4-year-olds through public and private provider partnerships.
providers.eligibility: Virginia resident families with income at or below 200% of the federal poverty level or children with identified risk factors, eligibility determined locally.
providers.name: Mixed Delivery Preschool Program

providers.description: A state-funded early childhood education program providing free, high-quality preschool to eligible four-year-old children through local school divisions and approved community providers.
providers.eligibility: Children who are four years old by September 30 and meet income or risk-factor guidelines as determined by local school divisions
providers.hours: Varies by local school division and provider
providers.name: Virginia Preschool Initiative (VPI)

providers.description: Public health insurance program providing medical coverage to eligible low-income individuals and families in Virginia.
providers.eligibility: Virginia residents who meet income, household size, age, disability, or pregnancy requirements.
providers.name: Virginia Medicaid

providers.address: 789 E. Main St, Suite 100, Richmond, VA 23219
providers.description: Statewide nonprofit providing advocacy, training, and resources to support victims of crime and the professionals who serve them.
providers.eligibility: Victims of crime in Virginia and victim service professionals
providers.name: Virginia Victim Assistance Network

providers.description: Provides crisis intervention, advocacy, shelter, and support services for survivors of domestic violence and sexual assault.
providers.eligibility: Individuals affected by domestic violence or sexual assault in the Fredericksburg region
providers.name: SAARA of Virginia

providers.description: Provides financial assistance to help eligible low-income households with home energy needs, including heating, cooling, and energy crisis situations.
providers.eligibility: Low-income households in Virginia that meet income and program requirements
providers.hours: Varies by local Department of Social Services
providers.name: Virginia Energy Assistance Program (EAP)

providers.description: Provides temporary cash assistance and work support services to eligible low-income families with children while promoting employment and self-sufficiency.
providers.eligibility: Low-income families with dependent children who meet income, resource, and work participation requirements
providers.hours: Varies by local Department of Social Services
providers.name: Virginia Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF)

providers.description: Provides financial assistance to eligible customers who are having difficulty paying their Virginia American Water utility bills.
providers.eligibility: Residential Virginia American Water customers experiencing financial hardship
providers.name: Virginia American Water – H2O Help to Others Program

providers.description: Provides financial assistance to help eligible low-income households pay overdue water and wastewater bills or prevent service disconnection.
providers.eligibility: Low-income Virginia households responsible for paying water or wastewater bills, including renters with utilities in their name; eligibility is determined by local administering agencies.
providers.name: Low Income Household Water Assistance Program (LIHWAP) - Virginia

providers.address: Service territory across DC, Northern Virginia, and Maryland
providers.description: Provides no-cost energy efficiency upgrades for income-qualified Washington Gas customers, including weatherization measures and high-efficiency natural gas equipment to reduce energy use and monthly bills.
providers.eligibility: Income-qualified Washington Gas residential customers; eligibility typically based on household income at or below program thresholds or participation in qualifying assistance programs
providers.name: Washington Gas – Income Qualifying Energy Efficiency Program

providers.description: HeatShare provides emergency natural gas bill assistance to eligible Columbia Gas of Virginia customers facing financial hardship, helping prevent service disconnection or restore service.
providers.eligibility: Must be a residential customer of Columbia Gas of Virginia experiencing temporary financial hardship; eligibility is determined through partner social service agencies.
providers.name: Columbia Gas HeatShare (Virginia)

providers.description: Utility assistance programs offered by Dominion Energy Virginia to help income-eligible households manage electric bills. The Percentage of Income Payment Plan (PIPP) limits monthly payments based on household income, while EnergyShare provides emergency assistance to prevent disconnection or restore service.
providers.eligibility: Income-eligible Dominion Energy Virginia customers; eligibility varies by program and household income level
providers.hours: Program hours vary; customers should contact Dominion Energy or local administering agencies
providers.name: Dominion Energy – PIPP / EnergyShare (Virginia)

providers.description: Provides monthly food assistance benefits to eligible low-income individuals and families to help purchase groceries.
providers.eligibility: Virginia residents who meet income, household size, and other program requirements
providers.name: Virginia Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP)

providers.description: Provides supplemental nutritious foods, nutrition education, breastfeeding support, and health care referrals for eligible women, infants, and young children.
providers.eligibility: Pregnant, postpartum, and breastfeeding women, infants, and children under age five who meet income and nutritional risk guidelines
providers.hours: Hours vary by local health department
providers.name: Virginia Women, Infants, and Children (WIC)

providers.description: Statewide information and referral service connecting individuals and families to local health, human, and social services across Virginia via phone, text, and online search.
providers.eligibility: Open to all residents of Virginia
providers.name: 2-1-1 Virginia
